description: A Late Iron Age settlement, later a Roman farmstead, and Villa. A roundhouse in the Late Iron Age was interpreted as a shrine by the excavators due to the lack of domestic material.
bibliography: Light, and Ellis. “Bucknowle: A Romano-British Villa and Its Antecedents, Excavations 1976-1991.” Dorset Natural History and Archaeological Society Monograph 18 (2009).
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Bucknowle (Dorset).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
